comments: After downloading the Connector/J source, I tried to create a new project based on an Ant config file. It properly reads the project name from build.xml, but does not find any javac declarations.

Thanks for the bug report Russell.
Unfortunately I will have to check whether I am permitted to download this source.

Can you help us out and try with the 3.2 Eclipse release candidate?

Which Connector are you using?

As well, can you describe what the javac task(s) declarations "look" like...that is any hints on why you would think the javac declarations are not picked up?

I just tried this with 3.2 RC4, and still had the same error. You probably can't look at it, it's licensed under the GPL (I have a commercial license for MySQL, so it's a little different for me -- that's why I'm trying to make my own build).
If for some reason anyone is allowed to look at it, I put it up at
http://www.rentmagic.ca/build.xml
I'm only starting to use Eclipse/Ant (finally moving from VC++!), so I don't really know what to look for to describe the javac targets. I /can/ tell you there are a large number of targets, many with javac. I wouldn't mind being stepped through a standard way to debug ant files. 

I just tried myself to comment out as many targets as possible, but it still didn't pick anything up. What other anomalies should I be looking for? It does work from the command line, when I specify the package "dist".

The problem here is our handling of invalid project names.

To workaround change the name of the project to not include path separators.
Fixed in AntNewJavaProjectPage and the nls files.
Please verify with the attached buildfile.

traces.message: Path for project must have only one segment.
